meanings.definition: A room in which printing presses are located.
meanings.sent1: The pressrooms were filled with noisy machines.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper office had a busy pressroom where the newspapers were printed.
meanings.sent3: The pressrooms were so crowded that the printers had to dance around each other to get their work done.
meanings.sent4: In the pressrooms, the printing presses roared like hungry lions.
meanings.sent5: The smell of ink and paper filled the pressrooms, creating a unique atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The department or section of a newspaper or magazine office where news is prepared for publication.
meanings.sent1: The pressrooms were abuzz with journalists working on breaking news stories.
meanings.sent2: The editor-in-chief oversaw the pressroom to ensure all articles were ready for print.
meanings.sent3: The pressrooms were like a beehive of activity, with reporters rushing to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent4: In the pressrooms, news stories were crafted like delicate pieces of art.
meanings.sent5: The pressrooms were the heart of the newspaper, where stories came to life.

meanings.definition: The group of journalists who cover a particular news beat.
meanings.sent1: The pressrooms were filled with reporters discussing the latest events.
meanings.sent2: The pressroom team worked tirelessly to cover the political beat.
meanings.sent3: The pressrooms were like a gathering of detectives, piecing together the news.
meanings.sent4: In the pressrooms, journalists were the storytellers of the community.
meanings.sent5: The pressrooms were a hub of information, where stories were born and shared.
